section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Caregiver" means a parent, spouse, guardian, legal custodian, or person responsible for the supervision of another adult.
"Law enforcement agency" means a State, county, or municipal police department or agency, or a sheriff's department.

"Missing person" means an individual:
whose whereabouts are unknown;
who suffers a cognitive impairment including a diagnosis of Alzheimer's disease or dementia to the extent that the individual requires assistance from a caregiver; and
whose disappearance poses a credible threat to the health and safety of the individual due to age, health, mental or physical disability, environment, or weather conditions, as determined by a law enforcement agency.
The Department of State Police shall establish a Silver Alert Program to provide a system for rapid dissemination of information to assist in locating a missing person.

text.section:
A caregiver or person filing a report regarding a missing person immediately shall notify the local law enforcement agency with which the report was filed and the Department of State Police if:
the missing person who was the subject of the report is located; and
it is unlikely that the local law enforcement agency or the Department of State Police has knowledge that the missing person has been located.
